table_description: DigitalOcean allows you to add SSH public keys to the interface so that you can embed your public key into a Droplet at the time of creation. Only the public key is required to take advantage of this functionality.

columns.name: id
columns.description: This is a unique identification number for the key.

columns.name: name
columns.description: The human-readable display name for the given SSH key.

columns.name: fingerprint
columns.description: The fingerprint value that is generated from the public key.

columns.name: public_key
columns.description: The entire public key string that was uploaded.  This is what is embedded into the root user's authorized_keys file if you choose to include this SSH key during Droplet creation.
